docs.snippet: Mr. Lamb’s performance in a southwestern Pennsylvania House race rattled Republicans and showed Democrats how to win back Trump voters.

headline.print_headline: Democrat’s Win On Trump’s Turf Offers Road Map
headline.main: Conor Lamb Wins Pennsylvania House Seat, Giving Democrats a Map for Trump Country

docs.snippet: President Trump, who said he would team up with Representative Kevin Brady of Texas, offered no specifics on the plan. But what they appear to be talking about would be less than meets the eye.

headline.print_headline: Trump Speaks Vaguely Of ‘Phase 2’ Tax Cuts
headline.main: Flush Over Tax Cuts, Trump Says ‘Phase 2’ Is Coming

docs.snippet: In some of the Mexican towns playing host to a "caravan" of more than 1,200 Central American migrants heading to the U.S. border, the welcome mat has been rolled out despite President Donald Trump's call for Mexican authorities to stop them.

headline.print_headline: Migrant Caravan Heading to U.S. Border Puts Mexico in Tough Spot With Trump
headline.main: Migrant Caravan Heading to U.S. Border Puts Mexico in Tough Spot With Trump

docs.snippet: A heated Facebook exchange over President Donald Trump brought Secret Service agents to a North Carolina man's door. But it wasn't until he made a profane defense of his First-Amendment rights that they slapped him with a criminal charge.

headline.print_headline: Man Charged After Profane Defense of Anti-Trump Online Post
headline.main: Man Charged After Profane Defense of Anti-Trump Online Post

docs.snippet: British Prime Minister Theresa May welcomed a U.S. move to expel 60 Russian diplomats over a chemical attack on a former Russian spy in the English city of Salisbury in a phone call with President Donald Trump, her spokesman said on Wednesday.

headline.print_headline: Britain's May Welcomes U.S. Expulsions Over Spy Attack in Call With Trump
headline.main: Britain's May Welcomes U.S. Expulsions Over Spy Attack in Call With Trump

docs.snippet: South Korea is trying to find out what President Donald Trump meant when he made remarks linking the recently renegotiated South Korea-U.S. free trade agreement with talks on denuclearizing North Korea.

headline.print_headline: South Korea Seeking Clarity on Trump Comments on Trade Deal
headline.main: South Korea Seeking Clarity on Trump Comments on Trade Deal

docs.snippet: Companies in Britain face a deadline to publish gender pay gaps, the Fed’s new chairman will speak and the Saudi crown prince wraps up his American tour.

headline.print_headline: Trump to List Chinese Products Facing Tariffs and Jobs Report Announced
headline.main: Trump to List Chinese Products Facing Tariffs and Jobs Report Announced

docs.snippet: Mexico's presidential front-runner launched his campaign close to the U.S. border on Sunday, demanding respect for Mexicans hours after U.S. President Donald Trump again threatened to scrap a key trade pact and erect a wall between the countries.

headline.print_headline: Mexico Is No 'Piñata,' Election Front-Runner Says After Trump Tweets
headline.main: Mexico Is No 'Piñata,' Election Front-Runner Says After Trump Tweets

docs.snippet: Despite its bumpy relationship with the Palestinians, the Trump administration is siding with the Palestine Liberation Organization in urging the Supreme Court to reject an appeal from American victims of terrorist attacks in the Middle East more ...

headline.print_headline: Trump Administration Backs PLO in Victims' High Court Appeal
headline.main: Trump Administration Backs PLO in Victims' High Court Appeal

docs.snippet: President Donald Trump's legal troubles deepened on Wednesday as a federal judge refused to throw out a lawsuit accusing him of flouting constitutional safeguards against corruption by maintaining ownership of his business empire while in office.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Judge Refuses to Toss Suit Against Trump on Foreign Payments
headline.main: U.S. Judge Refuses to Toss Suit Against Trump on Foreign Payments
